page.title: 03Law & Order.
page.content: In the past the local policeman had to come up from Minsterley Police Station on his cycle.The Minsterley Station closed in about 1970. Now the nearest Police Station is Pontesbury. Nowadays policemen can communicate with each other very well. They have radios to contact each other, but they can't communicate in Stiperstones because of the lead in the hills.The Police Station would have to contact them by telephoning.The policeman would have to tell his headquarters where he was going in this area and, if possible, tell them the phone number of his location. There isn't much vandalism or local burglary but the area does suffer from cattle and sheep rustling in the summer months,particularly on the open moorland.
